conclusion: Weight of the rod: mg = 0.01 kg × 10 m/s² = 0.10 N (downward, −y).
To cancel the weight with magnetic force, the magnetic force on the rod must be 0.10 N upward (+y).
Magnetic force magnitude on a straight conductor: F = I L B sin θ.
Here L ⟂ B, so sin θ = 1.
For an upward force, L (rod direction) must be opposite +x (i.e. along −x) when B is along −z.
Thus current flows from d to c (negative x-direction).
Current direction: from d to c, i.e. along the negative x-axis.
